supporting_text: The plan will present coordinated activities with expanded efforts into areas previously not focused on, such as the environment and agriculture.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen awareness and understanding of AMR in human health.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen biosecurity measures in the animal health sector.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen One Health surveillance and research efforts that involve environmental health.
The NAP includes strategies to promote good agricultural practices and strengthen biosecurity in the agriculture sector.
The NARC will report the progress of MyAP-AMR 2022-2026 implementation, including challenges identified and actions taken.
The NAP outlines specific targets such as a 5% reduction in antimicrobial use in the animal sector by 2026.
The NAP includes targets such as a 30% reduction in healthcare associated bloodstream infection due to selected MDROs by 2026.
The document does not specify any budget allocation for the strategies.
The document does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
The National Antimicrobial Resistance Committee (NARC) was established to govern and coordinate the AMR strategies.
The NAP includes strategies to develop and revise policies on the use of antimicrobial agents and strengthen enforcement activities.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen AMR educational programmes in schools and higher learning institutions.
The NAP includes strategies to engage with media and NGOs to increase AMR promotional activities.
The NAP emphasizes the need for collaboration with international organizations to combat AMR.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen the One Health surveillance programme that consists of a core set of organisms and antimicrobial medicines.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen laboratory capacity in the identification of pathogens and their antimicrobial susceptibility.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen the implementation of the Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) programme in healthcare facilities.
The NAP includes strategies to implement the Code of Practice to Minimise and Contain Foodborne Antimicrobial Resistance.
The NAP includes strategies to ensure activities of distribution, prescription and dispensing of antimicrobials are in accordance with national legislation.
The NAP includes strategies to develop and revise policies on the use of antimicrobial agents and strengthen enforcement activities.
The NAP includes strategies to develop collaborative research across all sectors to combat AMR.
